name: ABC
text: In his second virtual address in two days since his COVID-19 diagnosis, Pres. Trump says he is feeling "much better" and that the next few days will be "the real test." https://t.co/CGoDzglfIz https://t.co/pPEzq9nFo8

name: ABC
text: In light of the president's interactions with a broad cross-section of people and communities during this time, his positive test threatens to extend far beyond the West Wing. https://t.co/w9P3FYW38r

name: ABC
text: In his second virtual address in two days since his COVID-19 diagnosis, Pres. Trump acknowledged the millions of people globally who have been affected by COVID-19. https://t.co/CdCv4XTrV0 https://t.co/8Kt0XGBZSc

name: ABC
text: Experts recommend that high-level athletes be careful when returning to sports. https://t.co/tJbQVgT2fs

name: ABC
text: THE NOTE: This marks a moment bigger than politics: The 74-year-old president of the United States has tested positive for a disease that has killed more than 207,000 Americans. https://t.co/iY040ipSsb

name: ABC
text:
"While not yet out of the woods, the team remains cautiously optimistic."

Dr. Sean Conley says Pres. Trump has completed a second dose of remdesivir on Saturday and still did not require supplemental oxygen. https://t.co/IhED1AClN5 https://t.co/vtvmY0DYEm

name: ABC
text: Restaurant-goers need to continue being cautious and aware of their surroundings. https://t.co/zwjp628PGB

name: ABC
text: "Air purification is a big deal. And the thing is, is that's probably one of your most expensive expenditures you could possibly have." https://t.co/Zuzja9rgBg

name: ABC
text: Conflicting messages from public health authorities have fueled a great deal of confusion over COVID-19, particularly regarding its transmission. https://t.co/31yB3DvdMc

name: ABC
text: LATEST: White chief of staff Mark Meadows and Eric Trump, both spoke with Fox News host Jeanine Pirro, saying Pres. Trump was improving after some early concern. https://t.co/Ii3FUtKFFd

name: ABC
text: Everyone, 6 months or older, should get an annual flu vaccine, experts say. https://t.co/vL5tRFiOO9

name: ABC
text: NEW: Nick Luna, the current director of Oval Office Operations and bodyman to Pres. Trump has tested positive for the coronavirus. https://t.co/OUnxHBsIpj

name: ABC
text: REPORTER'S NOTEBOOK: Aboard Air Force One just before Trump tested positive. https://t.co/1Ov462GQJn

name: ABC
text:
Pres. Donald Trump may reasonably expect to be treated with a higher level of care and attention than the average American infected with COVID-19.

Experts say that may not be a good thing. https://t.co/MqSP0aR58t

name: ABC
text: Critics say the move will cause "widespread confusion." https://t.co/zOQ0qmWCZw

name: ABC
text: As confusion around the timing of the president's diagnosis and treatment grows—which is especially critical as the president had a busy week seeing many people around the country—here's what's known so far. https://t.co/ojSt2XYlhE

name: ABC
text: Two college students plummet four floors while taking selfie at a rooftop party. https://t.co/1kVkpTKG4k

name: ABC
text: Nick Luna, the current director of Oval Office Operations and bodyman to Pres. Trump has tested positive for the coronavirus. https://t.co/OtEl6d44lX

name: ABC
text: As confusion around the timing of the president's diagnosis and treatment grows—which is especially critical as the president had a busy week seeing many people around the country—here's what's known so far. https://t.co/M9fE4F5w5S

name: ABC
text: Several supporters of Pres. Trump who just days before had been toasting him at a fundraiser at his Bedminster, New Jersey, golf club said they are now quarantining themselves and going for coronavirus tests. https://t.co/pcwZ4212Q6

name: ABC
text:
"While not yet out of the woods, the team remains cautiously optimistic."

Dr. Sean Conley says Pres. Trump has completed a second dose of remdesivir on Saturday and still did not require supplemental oxygen. https://t.co/MILVRcTctU https://t.co/mRDt7qwMIR

name: ABC
text: RT @ABCPolitics: .@jonkarl on Pres. Trump’s condition after COVID-19 diagnosis: “It was maddening to see the medical team refuse to answer so many questions and to be spinning as if this was just another political briefing. Dr. Conley refused to answer basic questions.” https://t.co/wHLstt40ox https://t.co/3A71MSZlm2

name: ABC
text: RT @ThisWeekABC: “These are medical doctors. They should not be spin doctors,” @MarthaRaddatz says on doctors providing “very little information” on Trump’s condition, adding that conflicting info about a leader’s health “happens in North Korea —it should not happen here.” https://t.co/iJpXFwk0u6 https://t.co/WVg8j5EzxU

name: ABC
text:
.@GStephanopoulos: Trump "went ahead with his fundraiser in Bedminster even after the White House knew that Hope Hicks had tested positive. Why wasn’t that event cancelled?”

Jason Miller: “I can’t speak to...how much time (Trump) was spending with Hope.” https://t.co/E3g9lsHTnr https://t.co/J37RJHyVLy

name: ABC
text: California became the first state to pass a law establishing a task force to study and make recommendations on reparations for Black Americans. https://t.co/aFuQnuWt4D

name: ABC
text: Trump family, aides flouted Cleveland hotel mask mandate ahead of debate. https://t.co/HzMwnkjQ1a

name: ABC
ABC
text: Biden deputy campaign manager Kate Bedingfield says with “safety” precautions put in place, Biden will participate in next debate: “We send President Trump our best. We hope that he is well and able to debate. If he is, Joe Biden will certainly be there.” https://t.co/9rfhFS5Y9P https://t.co/QZMlznton4

name: ABC
text: Two salmonella outbreaks affecting dozens of people in multiple states have been linked to pet hedgehogs and bearded dragons, CDC says. https://t.co/2fVWont49M

name: ABC
text:
LATEST: White House senior adviser Stephen Miller tested negative for COVID-19, Trump campaign senior adviser Jason Miller told @ABC News.

Five of the nine known participants in the president's debate preparations on Monday have tested positive. https://t.co/QKcthUI483

name: ABC
text: Trump campaign senior adviser Jason Miller said that Pres. Donald Trump took early action against COVID-19 by closing down the country. https://t.co/iI2EukR4kN

name: ABC
text: MORE: Jason Miller defended the president’s handling of the COVID-19 pandemic on after a new @ABC News/Ipsos poll shows nearly 3 out of every 4 Americans doubt that Trump took the threat that COVID-19 posed to his well-being. https://t.co/4tMVajpliD

name: ABC
text:
Pressed by @GStephanopoulos on lack of masks at Trump events, Jason Miller claimed Biden uses masks as a “prop.”

Biden camp's Kate Bedingfield: “That tells you a lot of what you need to know about how the Trump campaign has treated this from the outset.” https://t.co/Cm7B5zNRhS https://t.co/gmOvSxmKxL

name: ABC
text: Since it was revealed that White House adviser Hope Hicks had tested positive for COVID-19, nearly a dozen other cases in Washington, D.C., have come to light—including that of Pres. Donald Trump. https://t.co/422YRLKcbV

name: ABC
text: ABC NEWS SPECIAL REPORT: Updates on Pres. Trump's condition outside Walter Reed Medical Center. https://t.co/kxR4BsS9J6

name: ABC
text: NEW: “Since we spoke last, the president has continued to improve. As with any illness, there are frequent ups and downs over the course,” President Trump’s physician Dr. Sean Conley tells reporters. https://t.co/9aZaXI7t8Q https://t.co/grFmsrqk5e

name: ABC
text: Dr. Sean Conley, physician to the president, on timeline of Pres. Trump's COVID-19 diagnosis and treatment: "Over the course of his illness, the president has experienced two episodes of transient drops in his oxygen saturation." https://t.co/9aZaXI7t8Q https://t.co/XhhmNyHdI1

name: ABC
text: A federal judge in California orders the Trump administration to continue its 2020 Census count through Oct. 31, overriding the administration's efforts to shorten the timeline to submit results. https://t.co/cUQJ11p6d1

name: ABC
text: Pressed on clarifying Pres. Trump's second drop in oxygen, Dr. Conley says "yesterday there was another episode," but doesn't offer clear answer on whether the president had another round of supplemental oxygen. https://t.co/9aZaXI7t8Q https://t.co/fQJr5Hh7wb

name: ABC
text:
After Dr. Conley said yesterday Trump was in great shape, chief of staff Mark Meadows said that Trump’s vitals were “concerning.”

Pressed on the inconsistent statements, Conley says that Meadows was referring to a “very transient limited episode.” https://t.co/9aZaXI7t8Q https://t.co/YICZc67Blp

name: ABC
text:
“I was trying to reflect the upbeat attitude” of the team and the president, Dr. Conley says when asked why he didn’t disclose Trump was administered oxygen until today.

“It came off that we were trying to hide something, which wasn’t necessarily true.” https://t.co/eDVO8k0zPW https://t.co/gwk7syGVgl

name: ABC
text: “The president wears a mask any time he’s around us,” Dr. Conley says when asked why Trump is not wearing a mask in videos and photos of Trump at Walter Reed, but won’t say if Trump was in negative pressure room: “I’m not going to get into the specifics.” https://t.co/eDVO8k0zPW https://t.co/CX8NyJVCfL

name: ABC
text: LATEST: Dr. Sean Conley, physician to the president, said over the course of exhibiting coronavirus symptoms, President Trump has experienced two episodes of "transient drops" in his oxygen saturation. https://t.co/VHg4SDxumB
